thread.title: First Draft: Carly Fiorina Raised $6.8 Million This Summer, Topping Previous Fund-Raising
thread.title_full: First Draft: Carly Fiorina Raised $6.8 Million This Summer, Topping Previous Fund-Raising

author: NICHOLAS CONFESSORE
title: First Draft: Carly Fiorina Raised $6.8 Million This Summer, Topping Previous Fund-Raising
text:
Nicholas Confessore Photo Carly Fiorina at a campaign event at the home of Drew and Lauren Cline in Bedford, N.H., last week. Credit Ian Thomas Jansen-Lonnquist for The New York Times Carly Fiorina raised $6.8 million in the three months ending on Sept. 30, a spokeswoman announced on Tuesday, a huge increase from her previous fund-raising. The surge came during a summer in which Mrs. Fiorina leapt over more established Republican rivals to become a significant contender for her party’s presidential nomination. Mrs. Fiorina’s total, more than three times what she raised through the end of June, gives her the third-biggest haul of the candidates who are actively raising money and have announced their totals for the quarter, behind Ben Carson and Senator Ted Cruz of Texas. (Donald J. Trump, who leads in many polls, is largely funding his campaign himself.) And her total comes after a period when two candidates with strong ties to the Republican donor elite, Rick Perry and Gov. Scott Walker of Wisconsin, dropped out of the race for lack of cash. Jeb Bush, the former Florida governor, has not yet announced his total for the quarter. Senator Marco Rubio of Florida raised about $6 million and ended the quarter with $11 million in cash on hand. Mrs. Fiorina’s spokeswoman, Sarah Isgur Flores, said on Twitter that the candidate began the fall with $5.5 million in cash on hand. Carly Fiorina’s ‘Super PAC’ Aids Her Campaign, in Plain Sight By NICK CORASANITI Mrs. Fiorina is among the presidential candidates trying to stay within federal rules, maneuvering around the gray areas and the loopholes while keeping campaign plans out in the open. Reclusive Media Mogul Stands Firmly in Carly Fiorina’s Corner By ERIC LICHTBLAU Mrs. Fiorina and Jerrold Perenchio, a billionaire who helped build Univision, became friends while traveling through similar business and political circles in California.
